Qingsong Wen, Ph.D. of Georgia Tech
Head of AI & Chief Scientist @ Squirrel Ai Learning, PhD Supervisor @ University of Oxford
Chair of CIS Task Force on AI for Time Series and Spatio-Temporal Data @ IEEE
Vice Chair of AI for Education Section @ INNS
Forbes Top 100 Most Influential Chinese Elites (福布斯中国全球最具影响力华人精英 Top 100)
qingsongedu(at)gmail.com Google Scholar GitHub LinkedIn

Qingsong Wen is currently the Head of AI & Chief Scientist at Squirrel Ai Learning (a top EdTech unicorn with 3,000+ learning centers across 1,500+ cities, serving tens of millions of students globally), and PhD Supervisor at University of Oxford. Before that, he worked at Alibaba, Qualcomm, Marvell, etc., and received his M.S. and Ph.D. degrees in Electrical and Computer Engineering from Georgia Institute of Technology, USA.

His research interests include machine learning, data mining, and signal processing, especially AI for Time Series, AI for Education, LLM & AI Agent. He has published over 150 top-ranked AI conference and journal papers, had multiple Oral/Spotlight Papers at NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, ACL, AAAI, had multiple Most Influential Papers at IJCAI, received multiple IAAI Innovative Application Awards at AAAI, and won First Place of SP Grand Challenge at ICASSP. Currently, he serves as Chair of IEEE CIS Task Force on AI for Time Series and Spatio-Temporal Data, and Vice Chair of INNS AI for Education Section. He also regularly serves as Area Chair of the top conferences including NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, KDD, IJCAI, ICASSP, etc, and Associate Editor for IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence (IF=20.8).

R&D Interests

AI for Time Series AI for Education LLM & AI Agent
